definition: to freeze over/to ice over/icebound/to shelve (a proposal etc)
ice/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/to chill sth/(of an object or substance) to feel cold/(of a person) cold/unfriendly/(slang) methamphetamine
to confer/to grant/to bestow a title/to seal/classifier for sealed objects, esp. letters

sentences.english: Among the endless icy mountains is Ilum's Crystal Cave.
sentences.chinese: 在無邊無際的冰封山脈中有伊冷的水晶洞。

sentences.english: The birds are finding it difficult to catch fish in ice-locked wetland areas.
sentences.chinese: 在溼地地區，鳥兒們難以在冰封的水面下捉魚吃了。

sentences.english: You started to think polar bear thoughts about icyness and wilderness.
sentences.chinese: 你開始想北極熊所想，想冰封的大地，想荒郊野外。

sentences.english: He will be the caretaker of the snowbound Overlook Hotel.
sentences.chinese: 他將成爲冰封的“眺望旅館”的看管員。

sentences.english: A thousand leagues of whirling snow.
sentences.chinese: 北國風光，千里冰封，萬里雪飄。

sentences.english: Spring, like a stout rod small group, he pushes open the thousands of miles of the northern ice.
sentences.chinese: 春天像一個粗壯的棒小夥，他撞開了北國的千里冰封。

sentences.english: Obviously he was not as dead as he seemed at the end of The Frozen Throne.
sentences.chinese: 顯然他並沒有像冰封王座結尾那樣被殺死。

sentences.english: This life brings an absurdness , Ice-bound all forever .
sentences.chinese: 這人生到底帶點荒謬，冰封了所有的永遠。

sentences.english: Arthas slays Illidan and reaches the Frozen Throne.
sentences.chinese: 阿爾塞斯擊敗伊利迪安，到達冰封王座。

sentences.english: I was frozen deep-sea, to find hope gap.
sentences.chinese: 我在冰封的深海，找尋希望的缺口。

sentences.english: Icebound river, let the distance of the other shore look like very short distance.
sentences.chinese: 冰封的河，讓彼岸的距離近似咫尺。

sentences.english: Description: The Frozen Coast is a treacherous coastline of ice.
sentences.chinese: 冰封海岸沿岸都是犬牙交錯的冰。

sentences.english: Severely cold ice-bound, which hasnt come the warm spring day?
sentences.chinese: 沒有嚴寒的冰封，哪來溫暖的春日？

sentences.english: Northland scenery, ice thousands of miles, miles.
sentences.chinese: 北國風光，千里冰封，萬里雪飄。

sentences.english: Cloud fastening under a white world, and ice that part of memory.
sentences.chinese: 雲，擰下一片雪白的世界，冰封了那段記憶。

sentences.english: Not any too many helplesses, already through ancient times ice-bound.
sentences.chinese: 沒有什麼太多的無奈，就已被亙古冰封。

definition: to freeze over (of water or land)
ice/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/to chill sth/(of an object or substance) to feel cold/(of a person) cold/unfriendly/(slang) methamphetamine
a world of ice and snow
